template_description: Standard template for service_architecture.json files based on UAF definitions
purpose: Provides the extra gravitational cohesion needed to hold galaxies and clusters together. Components: Non-baryonic particles that do not interact with light.

interfaces.name: Dark Matter Interaction
interfaces.description: Dark matter is a form of matter thought to account for approximately 85% of the matter in the universe. It does not emit, absorb, or reflect light, making it detectable only via its gravitational effects.
interfaces.source_verification: Hypothetical - supported by multiple lines of evidence but not directly detected. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_matter, https://science.nasa.gov/astrophysics/focus-areas/what-is-dark-matter/
